reviewText: I'm male and 37. I've got no kids; but I watch this show on Jetix addictively. It's a total blast, being smart,funny, and rather thought provoking occassionally. Pucca is not just for kids.I can't wait to have kids of my own so we can watch together. Good stuff.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great fun for my grandchildren. I hear them laughing all the time while playing. They often tell the other children that come over to the house about it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just love Pucca!! She's so cute. I just love when she beats up Tobe and Muji. And I especially love when Pucca runs after Garu, to kiss him. And when she catches him you see hearts go up to the sky as she kisses him. It's so cute.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pucca: Secret Samurai SantaCandy canes and Christmas cookies fly as Pucca, Garu, Santa and their friends take on winter - keeping one step ahead of polar bears, shifting glaciers and Santa imposters.Pucca has been super good this year, but will that be enough to get her what she wants for Christmas--the ninja boy Garu? Grab a hot bowl of noodles and hop on the sleigh.--These snow ninjas are just getting warmed up. Yule love it!Contains the following episodes:1  Tis the Season for Revenge2  Northern Lights Out3  Secret Santa4  On Thin Ice5  Snow Ninjas6  Woolen Warrior7  No Year's Eve8  Lumberjacked9  Puccahontas10  Swiss Kiss
Title: N/A

reviewText: OMG, a Christmas Pucca series?!?!  Yes, plesae!  My boys and I have been watching Pucca together since they were in preschool (they are now 5 & 7).  They love the humor and ninja action and I love the cuteness of Pucca and Garu.  It's a show I think both girls and boys (and parents and kids!) can enjoy together.  We love Pucca!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pucca: Secret Samurai Santa  Winter is the most exciting time of the year-- especially in Sooga Village. With Santa living in a candy cottage in the middle of town he defiantly knows who's is who. Pucca is adorable and this is a good animated move.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The entire Pucca series is strange and wonderfully different. This title is a bit of the same. I would recommend them all to anyone who would like their children or child to see something still age appropriate, but different.
